~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Questions & comments are welcome., 62137=June 2: Special guest and fellow Pastures of Plenty host Bill Murlin joined me to play songs that inspired his 50 plus year (and counting) career in folk music, featuring the Kingston Trio, the Chad Mitchell Trio, the Easy Riders (featuring Terry Gilkyson, Eliza's Dad), Pete Seeger and Woody Guthrie. We also played Bill's contemporary versions of his favorites performed by the Wanderers, which are Bill and his singing partner of 50 plus years Carl Allen. It was great fun and we barely got into the great old songs we wanted to play. To be continued..., 9963=Pastures of Plenty playlist Wednesday, July 28, 2010, 5:30 to 7:00 AM Host: John Risley Artist / Song / Album ******************************************************** Tracy Chapman / Let it rain / Let it rain (Elektra Records) The Kennedys / Happytown / Soougs for the open road (Appleseed) Richard Shindell / Darkness, darkness / Reunion hill (Shanachie) Bruce Cockburn / Wondering where the lions are / Slice o life (True North Records) John Prine / So sad / John Prine In spite of ourselves (Oh Boy Records) Madison violet / The Ransom / No fool for trying (True North Records) Tish Hinojosa / What more can I say in a song / Destiny's gate (Warner Brothers) Tish Hinojosa / Esperate / Destiny's gate (Warner Brothers) Vusi Mahlasela / Kuzobenjani Na? / World is Africa  (Universal music) Habib Koite / Sarayama / Ma Ya (Putumayo) Chieftains and Sting / Mo ghille mear / The wide world over (RCA Victor) Donal Clancy / The nomad / Close to home (Compass records) Solas / Ghost of Tom Joad / (Compass Records) Karan Casey / Johnny I hardley knew ye / Ships in the forest (Rough guide) Irish Rovers / Farewell to Nova Scotia / Irish Rovers greatest hits Irish Rovers / Nancy Whiskey / Irish Rovers greatist hits (MCA records) Sarah Harmer / Goin out / I'm a mountain (Zoe Records) Crooked Still / Undone in sorrow / Still crooked (Signature sounds) Slaid Cleeves / Dance around the fire / No angel knows (Rounder) Simon and Garfunkel / Wednesday morning, 3AM / Essential S and G (Columbia) Dougie MacLean / Rite of passage / D.
